dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The idea that the Houston consulate was just a regular diplomatic outpost is, uh, completely off base.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The idea that the Houston consulate was just a regular diplomatic outpost is, uh, completely off base.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hardline U.S. Senator Marco Rubio proclaimed that the site was the central node in the Communist Partys vast network of spies and influence operations in the United States.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Marco Rubio called it the central node for China's spy network in the U.S., which is a pretty bold claim to make during an election year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Marco Rubio called it the central node for China's spy network in the U.S., which is a pretty bold claim to make during an election year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hardline U.S. Senator Marco Rubio proclaimed that the site was the central node in the Communist Partys vast network of spies and influence operations in the United States.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And those images of documents burning in the courtyard—American intelligence must be desperate to know what exactly went up in smoke with just 72 hours' notice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And those images of documents burning in the courtyard-American intelligence must be desperate to know what exactly went up in smoke with just seventy two hours' notice.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: News of the expulsions featured firefighters outside the building in Houston as diplomats torched documents inside the complexs courtyard. American spooks would like to know what documents Chinese officials burned after being ordered out of the country with just 72 hours notice.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like both sides have abandoned any long-term strategy for working together, right? It's all confrontation now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like both sides have abandoned any long-term strategy for working together, right? It's all confrontation now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If leaders on either side of the Pacific had a long-term strategy of working together, its been thrown out in favor of confrontation. Which is not really a strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The U.S. is responding to China's wolf-warrior diplomacy with what some are calling jungle diplomacy—it's just escalation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The U.S. is responding to China's wolf-warrior diplomacy with what some are calling jungle diplomacy-it's just escalation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. seemingly has decided to meet wolf-warrior tactics on Chinas side with jungle diplomacy on its part.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's a far cry from that old Kissinger idea of Chinese leaders being patient long-term strategists. Xi Jinping seems to be rushing things.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's a far cry from that old Kissinger idea of Chinese leaders being patient long-term strategists. Xi Jinping seems to be rushing things.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Henry Kissinger school of Oriental inscrutability peddled the canard that Chinese leaders epitomized a unique ability to conduct long-term, patient statecraft. Nobody told Chinas president, Xi Jinping, or his wolf-warrior diplomats to be patient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: If he had been patient, he might have dominated East Asia within a decade, but instead he's pushing neighbors like Vietnam and India to resist.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: If he had been patient, he might have dominated East Asia within a decade, but instead he's pushing neighbors like Vietnam and India to resist.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If Xi had been more patient, much of East Asia would have been dominated by China within the next decade. Instead, he is goading countries around the region to resist China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like he's throwing Deng Xiaoping's advice—bide your time, hide your strength—right out the window.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like he's throwing Deng Xiaoping's advice-bide your time, hide your strength-right out the window.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Whatever happened to Deng Xiaopings dictum that China should bide its time and hide its strength? Yet Xi has effectively thrown Deng onto the dust heap of history, reaching back to the past in nurturing his neo-Maoist policies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And domestically, it's getting intense too. I mean, arresting people for blank sheets of paper in Hong Kong? Under a security law that overrode freedoms China once promised?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And domestically, it's getting intense too. I mean, arresting people for blank sheets of paper in Hong Kong? Under a security law that overrode freedoms China once promised?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Arresting people for holding up blank sheets of paper after threatening them under the new National Security Law, as happened in a shopping mall recently? In a place where China solemnly agreed to a mini-Constitution guaranteeing freedom of speech?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's worrying. Some historians compare this U.S.-China tension to Europe before World War I—sleepwalking into disaster.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's worrying. Some historians compare this U.S.-China tension to Europe before World War I-sleepwalking into disaster.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Historian Christopher Clarks The Sleepwalkers portrays a half-awake Europe stumbling into the horror of World War I. Much has been written comparing the world that Clark describes with the brewing Sino-U.S. conflict.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A ratchet effect, where each side takes turns tightening tensions, and it only moves one way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A ratchet effect, where each side takes turns tightening tensions, and it only moves one way.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Think of Sino-U.S. relations now as a ratchet. A ratchet only goes one directiontighter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And accidents can happen, like that 2001 mid-air collision. Back then it was resolved peacefully, but today? Hard to feel optimistic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And accidents can happen, like that two thousand one mid-air collision. Back then it was resolved peacefully, but today? Hard to feel optimistic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2001 a Chinese pilot collided with a U.S. spy plane, which made an emergency landing on Hainan Island. That dramatic incident was resolved peacefully. Its hard to believe that we would be so fortunate today.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Let's just hope neither side misreads the other's moves. The stakes are way too high for miscalculations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Let's just hope neither side misreads the other's moves. The stakes are way too high for miscalculations.
